content: <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit</origin>         <title>Traffic Accidents (Offenses)</title>         <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract>Traffic accidents in the City and County of Denver. The data is based on the National Incident Based Reporting System (NIBRS). The data is dynamic, which allows for additions, deletions and/or modifications at any time, resulting in more accurate information in the database. Due to continuous data entry, the number of records in subsequent extractions are subject to change. Accident data is updated Monday through Friday.</abstract>       <purpose>This dataset includes traffic accidents in the City and County of Denver for the previous five calendar years plus the current year to date.</purpose>       <supplinf>All Occurrence and Reported Times are recorded using Mountain Standard Time (MST).</supplinf>     </descript>     <status>       <update>Daily</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>-112.175139</westbc>         <eastbc>-104.345834</eastbc>         <northbc>39.936112</northbc>         <southbc>35.003856</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>     <keywords>       <theme>         <themekt>None</themekt>         <themekey>police</themekey>         <themekey>public safety</themekey>       </theme>       <theme>         <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Categories</themekt>         <themekey>location</themekey>         <themekey>society</themekey>         <themekey>transportation</themekey>       </theme>       <place>         <placekt>None</placekt>         <placekey>Denver</placekey>         <placekey>Denver County</placekey>         <placekey>Colorado</placekey>         <placekey>USA</placekey>       </place>     </keywords>     <accconst>None</accconst>     <useconst>ACCESS CONSTRAINTS:   None.   USE CONSTRAINTS: The City and County of Denver is not responsible and shall not be liable to the user for damages of any kind arising out of the use of data or information provided by the City and County of Denver, including the installation of the data or information, its use, or the results obtained from its use.   ANY DATA OR INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE City and County of Denver IS PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  Data or information provided by the City and County of Denver shall be used and relied upon only at the user's sole risk, and the user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the City and County of Denver, its officials, officers and employees from any liability arising out of the use of the data/information provided.   NOT FOR ENGINEERING PURPOSES </useconst>     <datacred>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / Business Applications Support</datacred>     <secinfo>       <secsys>AVAILABLE</secsys>       <secclass>Unclassified</secclass>       <sechandl>Available to the public and accessible through the Denver\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Open Data Catalog, http://data.denvergov.org/</sechandl>     </secinfo>     <native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.2.3200</native>   </idinfo>   <dataqual />   <spdoinfo>     <direct>Vector</direct>     <ptvctinf>       <sdtsterm>         <sdtstype>Entity point</sdtstype>         <ptvctcnt>103527</ptvctcnt>       </sdtsterm>     </ptvctinf>   </spdoinfo>   <spref>     <horizsys>       <geograph>         <latres>8.9831596510364909e-009</latres>         <longres>8.9831596510364909e-009</longres>         <geogunit>Decimal Degrees</geogunit>       </geograph>       <geodetic>         <horizdn>D WGS 1984</horizdn>         <ellips>WGS 1984</ellips>         <semiaxis>6378137.0</semiaxis>         <denflat>298.257223563</denflat>       </geodetic>     </horizsys>   </spref>   <eainfo>     <detailed>       <enttyp>         <enttypl>TRAFFIC ACCIDENTS (OFFENSES)</enttypl>         <enttypd>Crimes in the City and County of Denver</enttypd>         <enttypds>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</enttypds>       </enttyp>       <attr>         <attrlabl>OBJECTID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Internal feature number.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>INCIDENT_ID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Unique incident identifier assigned by the Records Management System.  There may be duplicate values due to multiple victims per incident or more than one crime per incident.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>OFFENSE_ID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Unique identifier for each offense derived by concatenating the INCIDENT_ID, OFFENSE_CODE, and OFFENSE_CODE_EXTENSION.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>OFFENSE_CODE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Offense codes were derived from the four-digit National Crime Information Center (NCIC) Uniform Offense Classification Codes.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>OFFENSE_CODE_EXTENSION</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Offense codes extensions are a one digit suffix to the OFFENSE_CODE that further describes the type of offense.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>OFFENSE_TYPE_ID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Offense type a short description of the offense.  Offense types are based on NIBRS crime types.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>OFFENSE_CATEGORY_ID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The Offense Category ID is an aggregate variable that groups similar crime types.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>FIRST_OCCURRENCE_DATE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The date and time the incident initially occurred.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>LAST_OCCURRENCE_DATE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The date and time the incident last occurred.  This variable most often used for property crimes such as a burglary which occurred between the time you left for work and returned home from work.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>REPORTED_DATE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The date and time the incident was reported to the police.  This can vary greatly from occurred time due to late reports, counter reports, etc.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>INCIDENT_ADDRESS</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The address where the incident occurred.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>GEO_X</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The x-coordinate in the state plane coordinate system.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>GEO_Y</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The y-coordinate in the state plane coordinate system.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>GEO_LON</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Longitude in decimal degrees.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>GEO_LAT</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Latitude in decimal degrees.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>DISTRICT_ID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Police district number. The city is divided into police districts. Each district has a primary station and is run by a police commander.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>PRECINCT_ID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Police precinct number. Each police district is subdivided into precincts.  Patrol officers are assigned to work in specific precincts during their shift.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>NEIGHBORHOOD_ID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The ID of statistical neighborhood boundaries that were developed in 1970 by the Community Renewal Program administered by the current Denver Department of Community Planning and Development. Statistical Neighborhoods are typically combinations of census tracts.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>City and County of Denver, Denver Police Department / Data Analysis Unit and Technology Services / DenverGIS</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SHAPE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Feature geometry.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>     </detailed>   </eainfo>   <distinfo>     <distrib>       <cntinfo>         <cntorgp>           <cntorg>City and County of Denver, Technology Services / Enterprise Data Management</cntorg>         </cntorgp>         <cntaddr>           <addrtype>unknown</addrtype>           <address>201 W Colfax Ave, Dept 301</address>           <city>Denver</city>           <state>CO</state>           <postal>80202</postal>           <country>USA</country>         </cntaddr>         <cntfax>720-913-5237</cntfax>         <cntemail>denvergis@denvergov.org</cntemail>         <hours>M-F 8:00am - 4:30pm (MST)</hours>       </cntinfo>     </distrib>     <distliab>See access and use constraints information.</distliab>   </distinfo>   <metainfo>     <metd>20140402</metd>     <metstdn>FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata</metstdn>     <metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998</metstdv>     <mettc>local time</mettc>   </metainfo> </metadata>
